  "article_text": [
    "matveev @xcite introduced an equivalence relation on @xmath0-manifolds generated by _",
    "borromean surgeries_. this surgery transformation removes a genus 3 handlebody from a @xmath0-manifold and glues it back in a nontrivial , but homologically trivial way .",
    "thus , borromean surgeries preserve the homology groups of @xmath0-manifolds , and moreover the torsion linking pairings .",
    "matveev gave the following characterization of this equivalence relation .",
    "[ matveev ] two closed , oriented @xmath0-manifolds @xmath1 and @xmath2 are related by a sequence of borromean surgeries if and only if there is an isomorphism @xmath3 inducing isomorphism on the torsion linking pairings .",
    "massuyeau @xcite showed that borromean surgery induces a natural correspondence on spin structures , and thus can be regarded as a surgery move on spin @xmath0-manifolds .",
    "he generalized theorem [ matveev ] as follows .",
    "[ massuyeau ] two closed spin @xmath0-manifolds @xmath1 and @xmath2 are related by a sequence of borromean surgeries if and only if there is an isomorphism @xmath4 inducing isomorphism on the torsion linking pairings , and the rochlin invariants of @xmath1 and @xmath2 are congruent modulo @xmath5 .    in a paper in preparation @xcite , the second author generalizes matveev s theorem to compact @xmath0-manifolds with boundary ( see theorem [ habiro ] below ) .    in the present paper ,",
    "we attempt to generalize the above results to compact spin @xmath0-manifolds with boundary .    after defining the necessary ingredients in sections [ ysurgery ] and [ rochlin ] ,",
    "our main result is stated in theorem [ r10 ] .",
    "the second author was partially supported by jsps , grant - in - aid for scientific research ( c ) 24540077 .",
    "the first author would like to thank anna beliakova for guidance and support , to christian blanchet , and to gwnal massuyeau for several helpful discussions .",
    "unless otherwise specified , we will make the following assumptions in the rest of the paper .",
    "all manifolds are compact and oriented .",
    "moreover , all @xmath0-manifolds are connected .",
    "all homeomorphisms are orientation - preserving .",
    "the ( co)homology groups with coefficient group unspecified are assumed to be with coefficients in @xmath7 .",
    "borromean surgery is equivalent to @xmath6-surgery used in the theory of finite type @xmath0-manifold invariants in the sense of goussarov and the second author @xcite .",
    "a _ @xmath6-clasper _ in a @xmath0-manifold @xmath1 is a connected surface ( of genus @xmath8 , with @xmath9 boundary components ) embedded in @xmath1 , which is decomposed into one disk , three bands and three annuli as depicted in figure  [ fig : y ] .",
    "-clasper.,width=151,height=132 ]    we associate to a @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 in @xmath1 a @xmath11-component framed link @xmath12 contained in a regular neighborhood of @xmath10 in @xmath1 as depicted in figure  [ fig : l ] .",
    "-clasper with a @xmath11-component framed link . here",
    "the framings of the three inner components are zero and the framings of the three outer components are determined by the annuli in the @xmath6-clasper.,height=151 ]    surgery along the @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 is defined to be surgery along the framed link @xmath12 .",
    "the result @xmath13 from @xmath1 of surgery along @xmath12 is called the result of _ surgery along the @xmath6-clasper _ @xmath10 and is denoted by @xmath14 .    by _ @xmath6-surgery",
    "_ we mean surgery along a @xmath6-clasper .",
    "thus , we say that a @xmath0-manifold @xmath2 is obtained from another @xmath0-manifold @xmath1 by a @xmath6-surgery if there is a @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 in @xmath1 such that the result of surgery , @xmath14 , is homeomorphic to @xmath2 .",
    "it is well - known that this relation is symmetric , i.e. , if @xmath2 is obtained from @xmath1 by a @xmath6-surgery then , conversely , @xmath1 can be obtained from @xmath2 by a @xmath6-surgery .",
    "the _ @xmath6-equivalence _ is the equivalence relation on @xmath0-manifolds generated by @xmath6-surgeries .      throughout the paper",
    ", we fix a closed surface @xmath15 , which may have arbitrary finite number of components . in this paper , we consider @xmath0-manifolds whose boundaries are parameterized by @xmath15 .",
    "a _ @xmath15-bordered _",
    "@xmath0-manifold is a pair @xmath16 of a compact , connected @xmath0-manifold @xmath1 and a homeomorphism @xmath17 .",
    "two @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds @xmath16 and @xmath18 are said to be _ homeomorphic _ if there is a homeomorphism @xmath19 such that @xmath20 .",
    "the notions of @xmath6-surgery and @xmath6-equivalence extend to @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds in a natural way .",
    "for a @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifold @xmath21 and a @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 in @xmath1 , the result of surgery @xmath14 has an obvious boundary parameterization @xmath22 induced by @xmath23 .",
    "thus surgery along a @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 in a @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifold @xmath16 yields a @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifold @xmath24 .",
    "two @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds @xmath16 and @xmath18 are said to be related by a @xmath6-surgery if there is a @xmath6-clasper @xmath10 in @xmath1 such that @xmath25 is homeomorphic to @xmath18 .",
    "the @xmath6-equivalence on @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds is generated by @xmath6-surgeries .",
    "the following well known characterization of the @xmath6-equivalence is useful .",
    "[ r1 ] two @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds @xmath16 and @xmath18 are @xmath6-equivalent if and only if there are finitely many , mutually disjoint @xmath6-claspers @xmath26 ( @xmath27 ) in @xmath1 such that the result of surgery , @xmath28 is homeomorphic to @xmath18 .",
    "let @xmath16 and @xmath18 be @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds .",
    "set @xmath29    a _ _ homology isomorphism _ _ from @xmath16 to @xmath18 ( or a homology isomorphism from @xmath1 to @xmath2 along @xmath30 ) is an isomorphism @xmath31 of the homology exact sequences of pairs @xmath32 and @xmath33 @xmath34 & h_i(\\partial m)\\ar[d]^{\\delta _ * } \\ar[r ] & h_i(m ) \\ar[r ] \\ar[d]^{f_i } & h_i(m,\\partial m ) \\ar[r ] \\ar[d]^{\\overline{f}_i } & h_{i-1}(\\partial m ) \\ar[r ] \\ar[d]^{\\delta _ * } & \\cdots\\\\ \\cdots \\ar[r ] & h_i(\\partial m ' ) \\ar[r ] & h_i(m ' ) \\ar[r ] & h_i(m',\\partial m ' ) \\ar[r ] & h_{i-1}(\\partial m ' ) \\ar[r ] & \\cdots \\\\ } \\ ] ] satisfying the following properties :    1 .",
    "@xmath35)=[pt]$ ] ; 2 .",
    "@xmath36 and @xmath37 are compatible with the intersection forms , i.e. , for @xmath38 , the square commutes : @xmath39^{f_i\\times \\overline{f}_{3-i } } \\ar[r]^-{\\langle,\\rangle_m } &   \\mathbb{z } \\ar@{=}[d]\\\\ h_i(m')\\times h_{3-i}(m',\\partial m')\\ar[r]^-{\\langle,\\rangle_{m ' } } &   \\mathbb{z } } \\ ] ] + here @xmath40 and @xmath41 denote the intersection forms . 3 .",
    "@xmath42 and @xmath43 are compatible with the torsion linking pairings , i.e. , the square commutes : @xmath44 ^ -{\\tau_m } \\ar[d]^{\\tors f_1\\times \\tors\\overline{f}_1 } &   \\mathbb{q}\\diagup \\mathbb{z}\\ar@{=}[d]\\\\ \\torsh_1(m')\\times \\torsh_1(m',\\partial m')\\ar[r]^-{\\tau_{m ' } } & \\mathbb{q}\\diagup \\mathbb{z}. } \\ ] ] here @xmath45 denotes torsion part , and @xmath46 denotes the torsion linking pairing of @xmath1 .",
    "the classification of compact @xmath0-manifolds up to @xmath6-equivalence is given by the following result .    [ habiro ]",
    "let @xmath15 be a closed surface , and let @xmath16 and @xmath18 be two @xmath15-bordered @xmath0-manifolds .",
    "then the following conditions are equivalent .    1 .",

    "2 .   there is a homology isomorphism from @xmath16 to @xmath18 .    for closed @xmath0-manifolds , theorem [ habiro ]",
    "is equivalent to matveev s theorem ( theorem [ matveev ] ) .",
    "for an oriented manifold @xmath1 with vanishing second stiefel - whitney class , let @xmath47 denote the set of spin structures on @xmath1 .",
    "it is well known that @xmath47 is affine over @xmath48 , i.e , acted by @xmath48 freely and transitively @xmath49    an embedding @xmath50 of a manifold @xmath2 into @xmath1 induces a map @xmath51 if @xmath52 is an inclusion map , @xmath53 , @xmath54 , is denoted also by @xmath55 .",
    "let @xmath10 be a @xmath6-clasper in a @xmath0-manifold @xmath1 .",
    "let @xmath56 be a regular neighborhood of @xmath10 in @xmath1 .",
    "note that the result of surgery , @xmath14 , can be identified with the manifold @xmath57 obtained by gluing @xmath58 with @xmath59 along @xmath60 .",
    "as is proved by massuyeau @xcite , for a spin structure @xmath54 , there is a unique spin structure @xmath61 on @xmath14 such that @xmath62 this gives a bijection @xmath63 the spin @xmath0-manifold @xmath64 is called the result of surgery on the spin @xmath0-manifold @xmath65 along @xmath10 .    as in section",
    "[ sec : y - surgeries - y ] , the _ @xmath6-equivalence _ on spin @xmath0-manifolds is the equivalence relation generated by @xmath6-surgery .",
    "let @xmath65 be a spin @xmath0-manifold possibly with boundary , and let @xmath66 be an orientable surface properly embedded in @xmath1 .",
    "then we can _ twist _ the spin structure @xmath67 along @xmath66 .",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> matveev introduced borromean surgery on @xmath0-manifolds , and proved that the equivalence relation on closed , oriented @xmath0-manifolds generated by borromean surgeries is characterized by the first homology group and the torsion linking pairing . </S>",
    "<S> massuyeau generalized this result to closed , spin @xmath0-manifolds , and the second author to compact , oriented @xmath0-manifolds with boundary .    in this paper </S>",
    "<S> we give a partial generalization of these results to compact , spin @xmath0-manifolds with boundary . </S>"
  ]
}
